intro: Geonoma procumbens, commonly known as the creeping geonoma, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often found in the understory of tropical forests. Its leaves are broad and strap-like, forming a rosette that can hold water, a characteristic feature of many bromeliads. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often followed by bright red berries, attracting various wildlife species.
